node.description:
The Business Year: Angola 2022 was produced with the support of the Agency for Private Investment and Export Promotion (AIPEX), the Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Angola (CCIA), and the Ministry of Agriculture & Fisheries, and features interviews with dozens of top decision-makers from every major sector of the economy, including a special focus on two areas tipped for growth; industry and agriculture.

Featured chapters:

Finance
Oil & Gas
Mining
Industry
Telecoms & IT
Agriculture & Food
Health & Education
Transport
Construction & Real Estate
Tourism

Interviews include:

Manuel José Nunes Júnior, Minister of State for Economic Coordination
António Henriques Da Silva, Chairman of the Board of Directors, Agency for Private Investment and Export Promotion (AIPEX) 
Vicente Francisco Soares, President, Chamber of Commerce and Industry of Angola (CCIA)
Vera Esperança dos Santos Daves de Sousa, Minister of Finance
Ivanilson Machado, CEO, Pumangol
Jose Ganga Júnior, Chairman
Paul Tewani, General Manager, Mafcom
Manuel Gomes da Conceição Homem, Minister of Telecommunications, Information Technology, and Social Communication
João Macedo, CEO, Novagrolider
Maria do Rosário Bragança Sambo, Minister of Higher Education, Science, Technology, and Innovation
Ricardo Viegas D’Abreu, Minister of Transport
Francisco Franca, CEO, Mota-Engil Angola Group
Afonso Vita, Director, Instituto de Fomento Turístico de Angola(Infotur)

The publication also features a range of articles and analysis, including:

Diversification
New financial system regulations
Energy transition
The diamond value chain
Retail
Tech start-ups
Tropical fruits
Digitalization in education
Angola as a regional maritime hub
Infrastructure

About The Business Year
The Business Year is a global media group that has been providing investors, businesses, and governments with first-hand insights into the world's most dynamic markets for over a decade. We conduct hundreds of interviews a week with top decision makers in the Middle East, Latin America, Central and Southeast Asia, Africa, and Europe. Our content is available in printed reports and across an array of digital platforms.
